Articles.Content:
I was able to launch KSP fine about a week ago, but now when I attempt to launch it it gets stuck and never loads, in spite of the fact that I didn't change anything. Using version 1.7.3.

Output log: https://www.dropbox.com/s/imtbftesdqwsqx8/output_log.txt?dl=0

Gamedata:
Don't know if it's responsible for your problem but you've got the KSP 1.8 of Hullcam installed. Try switching it to the previous release.

Some more log files and the mod list incl. version info would be useful

If you're using CKAN, you can easily export the mod list from there.

 

I'm wondering, as per your output_log.txt, you're 

Forcing GfxDevice: OpenGL Core

for any particular reason?

You say nothing has changed, but I won't exclude your PC did install Windows Updates, this could also cause the issue.
maybe you are using a module manager that is to old to be able to accept loading all patches that you have applied.

On 12/18/2019 at 9:18 PM, Aelfhe1m said:

Don't know if it's responsible for your problem but you've got the KSP 1.8 of Hullcam installed. Try switching it to the previous release.

Maybe. It's one of my most recently installed mods but I can't recall it causing any issues before.

On 12/19/2019 at 12:00 PM, VoidSquid said:

Some more log files and the mod list incl. version info would be useful

If you're using CKAN, you can easily export the mod list from there.

 

I'm wondering, as per your output_log.txt, you're 

Forcing GfxDevice: OpenGL Core

for any particular reason?

You say nothing has changed, but I won't exclude your PC did install Windows Updates, this could also cause the issue.

What other information would you like and where can these be found?

I don't use CKAN.

I use OpenGL because Textures Unlimited gives me a serious warning if I don't, I've used this for months mostly without issue.

My PC hadn't updated between the last times I played KSP.

21 hours ago, Church356 said:

maybe you are using a module manager that is to old to be able to accept loading all patches that you have applied.

Nope, Modulemanager should be fine.

I'd like to add that Kopernicus is a must-have, and it takes hours of reorganising and downloading mods to reinstall KSP, so updating to 1.8 and reinstalling aren't options for me.

That KSP.log should hopefully gives some information too, but from your outpot_log.txt, the last lines

NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at SimpleBoiloff.ModuleCryoTank.GetInfo () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

refer to ModuleCryoTank, I'd check if the respective mod is the culprit.
